othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Explains the eligibility criteria and benefits configuration for reward-saving programs, including how to define qualification rules, map reward tiers and link rewards to revenue line items.

othermeta.name: usecase
othermeta.content: documenting reward eligibility and benefits configuration

body.p: Qualifications & Benefits feature enables you to add products or categories for which you want to provide benefits.
In the New Program page, you can view the following options for Default Qualification Formula:
For more information about Volume Tiered qualifications and benefits, please refer to the Qualifications and Benefits section.
You can provide the following information on the Qualifications and Benefits page for Tiered programs:

entry.p: Add products or categories in the Product Name column. For adding products or categories, please refer to the Adding Products section. Products are the list of products that are purchased by the customer.
Enter the number of tiers. For example, 1,2, or 3. If you enter value 2, then the corresponding list will have Tier 1 and Tier 2 columns.

The value provided in the Tiers is the minimum value of the product which the customer has to purchase. For example, if the value in Tier 1 is 20, it means, if the customers want to achieve tier 1, then they have to buy the product's volume anything which is greater than or equal to 20 or less than 25 and the price given is 200$. 25 is the Tier 2 volume considered in this example, see the above image. Any product's volume which is greater than 25, which is tier 2 value, will be given for 180$.
Hence, the value given in a particular tier is the lower value and the higher value is anything which is less than the next tier.
If more than one participants purchase the same products then the Tier value will be decided based on the aggregated products' volume.
Price of the products defined for a particular tier.
Qualification Product not same as Benefit Product checkbox
When you select this checkbox you are mentioning that qualification product is different than benefit products.
Click Save to save the made changes.

body.note: In the Qualification and Benefits page, if you select CPG for qualifications products similarly you can view the CPG products in the Benefits products.
